results.title: Pola x [Widescreen] (E)
results.creator_credit: Leos Carax, Bruno Pesery, Arena Films and Polar Productions
results.brief_description: Leos Carax’s first feature since 1991’s “Les Amants du Pont Neuf” uses as its source material Herman Melville’s novel “Pierre or, the ambiguities”. In this modernisation of the novel, the comfortable world of privileged and idealistic novelist Pierre (Guillaume Depardieu) falls apart when he discovers that he has a sister called Isabelle, whose existence was kept secret from him by his possessive mother (Catherine Deneuve). This shock revelation causes Pierre to leave behind his charmed life and head to Paris where he embarks on a new novel and a journey to uncover the truth of the world. He soon discovers the dark side of human nature as he begins to slide into despair and embarks on a destructive relationship with his troubled sister. “Pola x” stumbles at times as it slips between youthful romanticism and utter nihilism. However it’s too easy to criticise Carax’s ambitious project or merely dismiss it as pretentious as some critics had. Ultimately “Pola x” maps a complex terrain, a grand, sweeping diatribe on contemporary society and, with that, it’s hard not to feel that Carax is as romantic and idealised as his tragic hero. Cast includes: Katerina Golubeva, Delphine Chuillot. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Point of danger: agriculture's first line of defence
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of quarantine officers inspecting imports from abroad to detect plant diseases and insect pests which may bring ruin and destruction to Australian agriculture if introduced into this country.

results.title: Point of contact
results.brief_description: Shows the work that ordinary untrained volunteers do as opposed to trained professionals in helping the mentally ill. Shows the Personal Emergency Service in operaiton, and how specially trained volunteers man the telephone and answer calls for help. Dr Dax tells how volunteers help rehabilitate the mentally ill at the Kew Mental Hospital (Kew Cottages?) and their work is illustrated. Written and introduced by Anthony Evans.

results.title: Po river valley (Italy)
results.creator_credit: John Ferno and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description: The Po River Valley contains half the population of Italy and is the centre of the textiles industries and steel mills. The rivers furnish electricity. Milan is the chief city, and industrial and finance centre, and we are shown a number of street scenes. Then we move into a typical farming community, the centre of which is a church over a thousand years old. The bells of this church summon the people to work in the morning, toll the lunch hour at noon and indicate the end of the workday in the late afternoon. This film shows glimpses of the community and the many shops that cater for the needs of the inhabitants and the trades that are handed down from father to son for generations, the women washing clothes on the riverbanks, and the men sitting over their coffee in the cafe. The church bell tolls for the last time during the day at sunset when the streets are gradually deserted.

results.title: Pneumonia
results.brief_description: A study of the dangers of neglecting pneumonic infection, how pneumonia is treated today and the effectiveness of newsy discovered drugs in reducing the death-rate due to pneumonia.

results.title: Pleuro
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis, Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Pleuropneumonia, the dread cattle disease. In one Victorian outbreak, 8000 cattle were quarantined and 7000 slaughtered. Despite a six month quarantine in NSW and a permit entry, northern cattle could introduce the disease again. The symptoms, hollow flanks, laboured breathing and dribble from the mouth, are not apparent in either the incubating or carrier animals. Farmers notify the local Department of Agriculture when the disease is first noticed. The suspect area is quarantined and all animals brought into the State in the same mob are blood tested in order to trace and eradicate the disease.

results.title: Plenty of nothing
results.brief_description: This program looks at the growing number of farmers’ wives, in Canada, who are now seeking legal recognition for their role in the family farm business. Many of these women devote most of their time to the family business and also look after the household, and they now feel that they should be equal partners with their husbands in the business.
